course_title: Veterinary Laboratory Diagnostics for Veterinary Technologists

learning_outcomes.description: Approach blood film evaluation at an advanced level
Identify situations in which blood smears, haematologic and clinical chemistry data should be flagged for pathologist review.

Describe all features of a diagnostic submission form and advise on appropriate collection and packaging of diagnostic specimens, including suitability of blood tubes for sample preservation and downstream testing.
Interpret clinical diagnostic data with a view to quality control (QC), and be able to describe generic QC considerations that are ubiquitous in a diagnostic laboratory.
Identify situations in which sample quality may affect downstream haematology and clinical chemistry data, and be able to describe basic troubleshooting approaches for such samples.
Be able to describe basic histology techniques, including fixation, tissue processing, sectioning and staining
Be able to describe infectious disease considerations in diagnostic laboratory workflow, including application of molecular diagnostic tools

assessments.task_description: A one hour online exercise, delivered in a standard Blackboard quiz format,Â requiring identification of leukocytes, assessment of red cell arrangement and morphology and platelet enumeration from provided digital images. The exercise can be accessed at any time during the date window, however it must be completed in a single sitting.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The Haematology Exercise can be accessed in the 'Assessment' section of the VETS3023 Blackboard site. This assessment item will be available after the gazetted opening date and can be undertaken and submitted at any time during the open period. The assessment item must be completed in a single sitting.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.due_date:
End of Semester Exam Period

2/11/2024 - 16/11/2024

This is a central invigilated INSPERA examination to be sat on campus
assessments.task_description: A 90 minute written examination canvassing ALL course material except for haematology.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
